Base.Explanation: Get information from a file or directory. The information includes the existence of the file or directory, type information (file or directory), attributes, creation, access times and size.

ArrayElement.Name: Target file/directory
ArrayElement.Description: The name of target file or directory. Can be specified using the full UNC path (recommended) or local path (local to the UMRA Service or Console application). Example: \\SERVER_A\Share_b\Directory_1\File.ext, \\SERVER_A\Share_b\Directory_1\Dir2, G:\UserData\John.

ArrayElement.Name: File/dir exists flag
ArrayElement.Description: Output only property. When specified, the output variable value is set to 'Yes' if the file or directory exists.

ArrayElement.Name: Is directory flag
ArrayElement.Description: Output only property. When specified, the output variable value is set to 'Yes' if the target path identifies a directory.

ArrayElement.Name: Attributes
ArrayElement.Description: Output only property. When specified, the output variable value is set equal to the attribute mask of the file or directory.

ArrayElement.Name: Creation time
ArrayElement.Description: Output only property. When specified, the output variable value is set to the creation time of the file or directory.

ArrayElement.Name: Last access time
ArrayElement.Description: Output only property. When specified, the output variable value is set to the last access time of the file or directory.

ArrayElement.Name: Last write time
ArrayElement.Description: Output only property. When specified, the output variable value is set to the last write time of the file or directory.

ArrayElement.Name: Size
ArrayElement.Description: Output only property. When specified, the output variable value is set to size of the file in bytes (meaningless value for directories: 0).

ArrayElement.Name: Error if not found
ArrayElement.Description: Set to 'Yes' if this action should produce an error in case the file or directory does not exist. Default value: 'No'.

Base.Explanation: Delete the specified file or files. The file name specification can contain wildcards (*, or ?).

ArrayElement.Name: File path
ArrayElement.Description: The full path of the file(s). The path should start with a logical drive (example G:\) or share name \\COMPUTER\Share. The path name may contain the wildcard characters * and ?. Examples: G:\Data\*.txt, \\PC\Share\UserData\John\Project?.*.

ArrayElement.Name: Include subdirectories (recursive)
ArrayElement.Description: Specify 'Yes' searh for the specified file(s) recursively.

ArrayElement.Name: Use backup and restore privileges
ArrayElement.Description: A flag indicating that backup and restore privileges must be used to delete the files. This property is required in case the logged on user has no access rights to the directories and files that must be deleted. The logged on user must have the corresponding access rights configured on the target computer to use these privileges successfully. See the online help for more information.

ArrayElement.Name: Ignore error
ArrayElement.Description: A flag indicating that errors must be ignored. An error is for instance generated when the target file does not exist or cannot be deleted.

Base.ErrorVariableContents: Error bij ophalen van AFAS Data (Get Employee Contracts)

Base.Explanation: Export the data of an AFAS Online to a csv file on the computer running the Tools4ever PowerShell Agent.

Base.Name: AFAS Connection
Base.Description: This parameter identifies the PowerShell Agent service session.

Base.Name: Connector name
Base.Description: The name of the connector from which the data should be exported.

Base.Name: Filter XML
Base.Description: The xml text which should be used to filter the data.

Base.Name: Include meta data
Base.Description: Set to 'Yes' to include meta data in the export or to 'No' otherwise. If not specified 'No' is assumed.

Base.Name: Export as XML
Base.Description: Set to 'Yes' to export as XML or to 'No' to export as CSV. If not specified 'No' is assumed.

Base.Name: Output options
Base.Description: Specify the output options value. For csv the following values can be used: 1, 3* = semicolon, 2, 4* = tab. *1, 2: dates and numbers in regional format. *3, 4: dates and numbers in standard format. For XML 2 is only filled values, 3 means including empty fields. If nothing is specified 3 is assumed.

Base.Name: File name
Base.Description: The name and path of the file to export the data to. This file is written by the Tools4ever Powershell agent. Specify a path, the Tools4ever Powershell Agent has access to. If the file has to be imported later on the script with the Umra Service or Console, make sure those components have also access to the file. If not specified a local filename is generated and given as output.

Base.ErrorVariableContents: Fout bij ophalen AFAS Profit tabel vanaf de umra server: %AfasStaffContractCSV%
Error bij querie op personeelstabel uit de UMRA database
Error bij joinen van tabellen vanuit Beaufort en AD.
